title: Bad Triple
content:
A triple (a,b,c) is **bad** if a | (b+c) and a < min(b,c).

The second condition prevents trivial cases like a = b = c.

title: Divisibility-Free Set
content:
A set A is **divisibility-free** if it contains no bad triples.

This is the central condition of Erdős Problem #13.

title: Alternative Characterization
content:
Equivalently: for all a,b,c ∈ A with a < min(b,c), we have a ∤ (b+c).

This unpacks the definition into a more usable form.

title: Upper Third
content:
**upperThird(N)** = the interval (2N/3, N] ∩ ℕ.

This is the optimal divisibility-free set achieving size N/3.

title: Upper Third is Divisibility-Free
content:
The upper third contains no bad triples.

Proof: If a,b,c ∈ (2N/3, N] with a < b,c and a | (b+c), then b+c ≥ 2a. But b+c > 4N/3 and a > 2N/3 leads to contradiction.
mathContext: This is the key property that makes the construction work.

title: Size of Upper Third
content:
|upperThird(N)| = N - 2N/3 ≈ N/3.

The upper third achieves the conjectured bound.

title: Achieves N/3 Bound
content:
For N ≥ 3: |upperThird(N)| ≥ N/3.

This shows the N/3 bound is tight.

title: Bedert's Theorem (2023)
content:
**Bedert (2023):** Any divisibility-free A ⊆ {1,...,N} has |A| ≤ N/3 + O(1).

This solved Erdős Problem #13 and earned the $100 prize.
mathContext: The O(1) is an absolute constant independent of N.

title: Upper Third is Optimal
content:
The upper third construction is essentially optimal: |A| ≤ |upperThird(N)| + C.

No divisibility-free set can be significantly larger.

title: r-Divisibility-Free
content:
A set is **r-divisibility-free** if for all a, b₁,...,bᵣ ∈ A with a < min(bᵢ), we have a ∤ (b₁+...+bᵣ).

This generalizes the original condition to r-element sums.

title: r=2 Recovers Original
content:
2-divisibility-free is equivalent to divisibility-free.

This shows the generalization is consistent.

title: Upper Fraction
content:
**upperFraction(r, N)** = elements k with rN < (r+1)k.

For r=2: upper 2/3. For r=3: upper 3/4. Etc.

title: r-Sum Conjecture
content:
**Erdős Conjecture:** For r-divisibility-free sets, |A| ≤ N/(r+1) + O(1).

OPEN for r ≥ 3. The r=2 case is Bedert's theorem.

title: r=2 Case Proved
content:
The r=2 case of the r-sum conjecture is exactly Bedert's theorem.

This connects the general conjecture to the solved case.

title: Membership Characterization
content:
k ∈ upperThird(N) iff k ≤ N and 2N < 3k.

This gives an explicit criterion for membership.

title: Sum-Free Set
content:
A set is **sum-free** if a + b ≠ c for all a,b,c in the set.

This is a different but related constraint to divisibility-free.

title: Upper Third is Sum-Free
content:
The upper third is ALSO sum-free: for a,b,c ∈ (2N/3, N], we have a + b > 4N/3 > N ≥ c.

So a + b > c, hence a + b ≠ c.
mathContext: This is a bonus property - the same construction works for two different problems!
